info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:59AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Fairfield County through 230 AM EDT... At 159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Fairfield, or near Pawling, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Brookfield and New Fairfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
